lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Jav_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/jarvis.Jarvis.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run jarvis.Jarvis.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

* the dialog container. Clears the user input after processing.

* For storing deadline to data file

* Compare the priority of this deadline with other tasks
* Deadlines have higher priority than events and todos,
* Compare among deadlines by their time. Earlier time has higher priority
* @param task2 the other task to be compared with
* @return The priority -1, 0 or 1 as specified above
if (task2 instanceof Todo || task2 instanceof Event) {
* A class that represent an event, have a event date "at"
* Construct a event from users' input
* @param input Include both description and specified time
* @param isDone Whether the event is done when constructed
* @throws DateTimeParseException Possible wrong time format when parsing the time
public Event(String input, boolean isDone) throws DateTimeParseException {
public Event(String input, String at, boolean isDone) {
* For storing event to data file
* @return The string representation of this event in data file
* Compare this event with other task
* Events has higher priority than todos(-1) and lower than deadlines(1)
* Compare among events by their time. Earlier time has higher priority
* @param task2 the other task to be compared with
* @return The priority -1, 0 or 1 as specified above
* Contains the information that todo, event, deadline have in common
public abstract class Task implements Comparable<Task> {
* Get icon of whether the task is done
* @return "X" if done and " " if not done
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
